Lift of Ban on Connection with Internet Sites Demanded
S. Korean Authorities' Action to Cut Off Operation of Internet Sites Assailed
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Action to Cut Off Operation of Internet Sites Assailed 
    Pyongyang, November 23 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the National Democratic Front of south Korea on Nov. 19 released a statement denouncing the south Korean authorities' action to cut off the operation of "pro-north sites," according to Kuguk Jonson Internet site.
 The statement branded this anachronistic action as fascist tyranny as it ruthlessly infringes upon the people's right to know and an intolerable perfidy to the historic June 15 joint declaration supported by all the Koreans. It strongly demanded the south Korean authorities immediately lift this ban. 
 The authorities instructed the Ministry of Information and Telecommunication to force the business bodies for Internet information service to close all north-related sites, the statement said, and went on:    
 Such action reminds one of the dark period of the press under the military fascist dictatorship when the people's freedom of thinking and expression was mercilessly suppressed on the charge of being "pro-north" and "pro-communism." 
 The reality goes to clearly prove that though the authorities talk much about south-north reconciliation and cooperation, they have an axe to grind and that south Korea is a barren land of the press and human rights where no one is allowed to freely use the Internet though it is in wide use worldwide.    
 The authorities should immediately lift the ban on the above-said Internet sites, clearly mindful that the action going against the trend of the times and mind-set of the people will only precipitate their own destruction.

Gift to Kim Jong Il from Syrian Organization
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Syrian Organization 
    Pyongyang, November 23 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il received a gift from the Federation of Transport Trade Unions of Syria.
 The gift was handed to an official concerned by Ghassan Aboud, head of the delegation of the federation, on a visit to the DPRK.

Secretaries of WPK Central Committee Meet New Cuban Ambassador
articles.content:
Secretaries of WPK Central Committee Meet New Cuban Ambassador
    Pyongyang, November 23 (KCNA) -- Jon Pyong Ho, Choe Thae Bok, Jong Ha Chol and Kim Ki Nam, secretaries of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, met and had friendly talks with Ruben Perez Valdes, new Cuban ambassador e.p. to the DPRK, who paid courtesy calls on them on Tuesday.
 Present there were Pak Kyong Son, vice department director of the WPK Central Committee, and Caridad Adela Galan Pelegrino, political councilor of the Cuban embassy here.
